info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 30 at 3:26PM MDT until June 30 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM MDT FOR EAST CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTY... At 326 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Maxwell, or 11 miles northeast of Springer, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Maxwell and Raton Crews Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 419 and 445. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 333 and 340. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Accumulations of hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
